directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a bundt pan with non-stick spray.
Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Combine the eggs, sugar, yogurt, applesauce, oil, lime zest, and lime extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry, and mix until just combined. Tint with 2-3 drops green food coloring (optional).
Pour the batter into the prepared bundt pan, bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour (or until done).
Prepare the soaking syrup by microwaving the sugar and lime juice in a 2 cup pyrex measuring cup.

When the cake is done, allow to cool 5 minutes, then slowly pour the soaking syrup over the cake, allowing it to absorb in. (You can poke a few holes in the top of the cake with a wooden skewer first â€“ this will help the soaking syrup absorb deeper into the cake.)
Allow the cake to cool another 30 minutes in the pan, invert onto a serving platter. Prepare the glaze by mixing the powdered sugar with the remaining lime juice.
When the cake is completely cool, drizzle the glaze over the top, and sprinkle with some flaked coconut.
ingredients: Use lime extract, if you can find it.
Zest all your limes before you juice them.
title: Coconut Lime Bundt Cake
